column4: anyone point me to a web page, that says what servers to use for apt-get?
ubuntu selects the best servers for you at install time
they should already be setup
explain errors out ?
Err http://security.ubuntu.com maverick-security/multiverse i386 Packages   Unable to connect to security.ubuntu.com:http: [IP: 91.189.92.167 80]
can you ping that host ?
ping http://security.ubuntu.com ping: unknown host http://security.ubuntu.com
ping www.google.com PING www.l.google.com (74.125.159.104) 56(84) bytes of data. 64 bytes from yi-in-f104.1e100.net (74.125.159.104): icmp_req=1 ttl=55 time=18.1 ms
the host is security.ubuntu.com not http://security.ubuntu.com
you don't ping "http" you ping the host name
sorry yes i can  ping security.ubuntu.com PING security.ubuntu.com (91.189.92.167) 56(84) bytes of data. 64 bytes from bignay.canonical.com (91.189.92.167): icmp_req=1 ttl=50 time=116 ms
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list and "ls -la /etc/apt/source.d
http://pastebin.com/Q3XerCnq  ls -la /etc/apt/source.d ls: cannot access /etc/apt/source.d: No such file or directory
what happens if you do "sudo apt-get update"
it erros out
Err http://security.ubuntu.com maverick-security/multiverse i386 Packages   Unable to connect to security.ubuntu.com:http: [IP: 91.189.92.166 80]
that server is responding
yes i can pink it
so some networking (routing/firewalling) is blocking it on your machine, that's what you need to resolve
do any other package hosts error, or just security
all of them error
ok, so there is something wrong with your networking
saying anyone is totally pointless as I've stated earlier
the downloads have all failed
